radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed Tomographic Angiography (CTA) of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: Several small segmental and subsegmental pulmonary emboli on the right side, which were slightly decreased in size from the previous study.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Slightly decreased in size from the previous study.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Moderate scoliosis, normal heart size, clear lung fields, and an indwelling port catheter with the tip positioned in the right atrium.
Normal biventricular function, a large pedunculated mass on the atrial side of the tricuspid valve, and moderate tricuspid regurgitation.
Early microbubble appearance on the left side of the heart, consistent with interatrial shunting.
